intro: Oldenlandia benguellensis, commonly known as the Benguela mistflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
